intro: Indigofera oxytropis, commonly known as the Afghan indigo or mountain indigo, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to regions of Central Asia, including Afghanistan, Pakistan, and parts of the Middle East. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and trifoliate leaves, which are often hairy. Its small, pea-like flowers are typically pink or purple, and it produces small, lens-shaped pods containing several seeds. Indigofera oxytropis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species found in rocky and mountainous terrain.
